creditline: Gift of funds from Mary and Bob Mersky
description: circular border, with image of a figure lying on a bed; large format camera with man standing behind it on L; large black and white photograph in background
markings: BC, verso: Weinstein Hammons Gallery label
text:
At a time of political divide, Alec Soth set out on a journey across the United States intending to follow the  path of President Abraham Lincoln’s funeral train. While on the trip he became more interested in photography’s physical, historical, and conceptual weights. 
A landscape photograph looms heavily above the hotel bed. Soth’s daughter, Carmen, who has collaborated with him in the past, is serious in repose. With his view camera just at left, Soth places himself within the composition, possibly depicting a moment of rest or tension in their joint travels.
title: Carmen, Williams, Arizona
